results.title: Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (S. Con. Res. 3) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2017 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2018 through 2026, and providing for consideration of the bill (S. 84) to provide for an exception to a limitation against appointment of persons as Secretary of Defense within seven years of relief from active duty as a regular commissioned officer of the Armed Forces.

actions.description: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 235 - 188 (Roll no. 56). (text: CR H477)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 179 (Roll no. 55). (consideration: CR H489-490)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 48.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H477-490)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 4.

The resolution provides for two hours of general debate on S. Con. Res. 3 under a structured rule, and ninety minutes of debate on S.84. The resolution also provides for one motion to commit on S. 84.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-4, by Mr. Woodall.
